result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wesley R Burton

records.addlTxt:
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence; Attorney Peter Rotter appears in person
DATES: 
Remove 10/05/22 PTC and11/18/22 Prelim
JPTC set: 11/18/22 at 11:00 am
Judicial Pretrial - in court on November 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:36 a.m. 
Clerk: Micki.

Defendant appears in person, pro se.
OTR: 9:37 a.m.
BOTR: 9:38 a.m.
Telephoned SPD to confirm Defendant is not eligible.  
Court questions defendant RE: Employment/Income. 
Court appoints Attorney Peter Rotter @ $100/hr. not to exceed $1,000.00 without further order of the Court. 

Adj: 9:43 a.m.

Indigency hearing on September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 5, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on November 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Marathon County Victim Waiver of No Contact Bond Condition- M.A.

No contact with victim(s): M.A. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence.
